feed.title: talk | Tom Philip - Full Stack, Rails, .NET, Android and Boxee Developer

entry.title: Dependency Inversion Principle
entry.content:
Slides and code from a talk I gave on the Dependency Inversion Principle. Covers Dependency Injection, Service Location, TDD & Mocking (how they play together nicely), Auto-mocking, IOC tools and a little best practice.

The code used in the talk is available at https://github.com/tommysqueak/dependency-inversion-talk

More presentations from Tom Philip.

entry.title: Great Software Design Slides
entry.content:
Another talk I gave today about not just good software design but Great Software Design.  Takes in SOLID, Design Patterns, Anti-Patterns and Tips.

More presentations from Tom Philip.

entry.title: Sociable Software Delivery - An Introduction to BDD
entry.content:
Here's the slides from a talk I gave to staff at my current client New Mind.  It's an introduction to Behaviour Driven Development, from idea to working software.

More presentations from Tom Philip

entry.title: Business Model Canvas Slides @ Lean Liverpool
entry.content: Here's the slides from a talk I gave at Lean Liverpool, on 8th Dec 2011, about the Business Model Canvas. What it is and how you can use it with Lean Startup and Customer Development. With my fear of public speaking and man flu on top of it, I bumbled through the talk. So I do recommend you read the book Business Model Generation, if my talk was incoherrent. If it wasn't, still go out and get the book, it's a fantastic read. Also included in the slides is the Business Model Canvas we created at the end, as part of an exercise. Breakfast Delivery for the Lazy!

entry.title: BDD Talk
entry.content:
Gave a talk about BDD to the guys at work, about how we use it and could do more of it. Not Business Driven Development, as I'd got into my head and kept referring to it as. It was a bit embarrassing when, towards the end, somebody said that they'd heard about something like this called Behaviour Driven Development.

BDD on Prezi
